'''René van Rossenberg''' (born 1961) a Dutch author and collector. He runs the [[Tolkien Winkel]] and its Museum, and is an active member of [[Unquendor]] (he was chairman from 1986 to 1996).
==Biography==
R.J. (René) van Rossenberg holds a MA in History from Leiden University in the Netherlands. He first read [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[The Hobbit]]'' (De Hobbit in Dutch) in 1973 at age 12. He became an avid Tolkien collector as well as a board member and ten year chairman of the Netherlands Tolkien Society Unquendor. From this society's bookstore he developed his own full time business: the Tolkienwinkel. He also lecture(s)(d) at Leiden University and review(s)(ed) books translated into Dutch to supplement his income. To date he still lives in Leiden. At one point he bought [[Joy Hill]]'s (Tolkien's private secretary), library of books at auction. He was working on his PhD through the early 2000s but is unclear whether he completed this.<ref>http://web.archive.org/web/20000901093458/http://www.xs4all.nl/~rossnbrg/me.htm (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref> He has supplemented Dutch translations of Tolkien books with his reflections on occasion.<ref>https://www.boekerij.nl/producten/de-aanhangsels-9789022551356</ref>

René van Rossenberg is occasionally interviewed by the Dutch press on matters pertaining to JRR Tolkien.<ref>https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2022/08/30/nieuwe-serie-the-rings-of-power-schept-opnieuw-tolkien-discussies-2-a4140247</ref><ref>https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2007/03/06/uniek-is-de-flipperkast-van-lord-of-the-rings-11285966-a390825</ref><ref>https://www.ad.nl/video/productie/fans-gespannen-voor-nieuwe-prime-serie-the-rings-of-power-324736</ref><ref>https://www.dutchnews.nl/2019/02/leidens-not-so-visible-oddities-mysterious-stairways-stone-tables-and-gandalf/</ref><ref>https://www.ecommercenews.nl/tolkien-obsessie-leidt-tot-webwinkel-met-5k-omzet/</ref><ref>https://sleutelstad.nl/programma/radio-weetlust/uitzending/2022-09-02/</ref><ref>https://www.nporadio1.nl/nieuws/binnenland/176bac69-61f1-4198-9153-8f91ecff4aca/podcast-de-dag-waarom-blijft-tolkien-jaren-na-zijn-dood-nog-zo-populair</ref><ref>https://www.leidschdagblad.nl/cnt/dmf20180926_18156193</ref><ref>https://www.vpro.nl/programmas/ovt/speel~POMS_VPRO_209184~ovt~.html</ref><ref>https://www.studioalphen.nl/nieuws/opening-eerste-chte-tolkienwinkel/</ref><ref>https://fd.nl/frontpage/ondernemen/1083866/uit-de-hand-gelopen-hobby-groeit-uit-tot-webwinkel-van-half-miljoen</ref><ref>https://sleutelstad.nl/2004/08/02/leiden-krijgt-tolkien-winkel/</ref>

===Tolkien's 1958 visit to Rotterdam===
Van Rossenberg also uncovered the audio recordings of the [["Hobbit Dinner" in Rotterdam]], Netherlands where Tolkien participated. He published an article on this: “Tolkien’s Exceptional Visit to Holland: A Reconstruction” in the [[Proceedings of the J.R.R. Tolkien Centenary Conference]].
